1.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
a year (as a revolution of time)
Chizkijah, a king of Judah, also the name of two other Israelites
to ascend, intransitively (be high) or actively (mount); used in a great variety of senses, primary and secondary, literal and figurative
Ashshur, the second son of Shem; also his descendants and the country occupied by them (i.e. Assyria), its region and its empire
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a city (a place guarded by waking or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere encampment or post)
Jehudah (or Judah), the name of five Israelites; also of the tribe descended from the first, and of its territory
to gather grapes; also to be isolated (i.e. inaccessible by height or fortification)
to manipulate, i.e. seize; chiefly to capture, wield, specifically, to overlay; figuratively, to use unwarrantably

2.brief: to send away, for, or out (in a great variety of applications)
a king
Ashshur, the second son of Shem; also his descendants and the country occupied by them (i.e. Assyria), its region and its empire
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
Rabshakeh, a Babylonian official
Rabshakeh, a Babylonian official
Lakish, a place in Palestine
Jerushalaim or Jerushalem, the capital city of Palestine
near, with or among; often in general, to
a king
Chizkijah, a king of Judah, also the name of two other Israelites
an army; also (by analogy,) an intrenchment
heavy; figuratively in a good sense (numerous) or in a bad sense (severe, difficult, stupid)
to stand, in various relations (literal and figurative, intransitive and transitive)
a channel (into which water is raised for irrigation); also a bandage or plaster (as placed upon a wound)
a reservoir (at which camels kneel as a resting-place)
an elevation, i.e. (adj.) lofty (compar.); as title, the Supreme
a thoroughfare (as turnpiked), literally or figuratively; specifically a viaduct, a staircase
a field (as flat)
to trample; hence, to wash (properly, by stamping with the feet), whether literal (including the fulling process) or figurative

3.brief: to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.
near, with or among; often in general, to
Eljakim, the name of four Israelites
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
Chilhijah, the name of eight Israelites
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
properly, to score with a mark as a tally or record, i.e. (by implication) to inscribe, and also to enumerate; intensively, to recount, i.e. celebrate
Joach, the name of four Israelites
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
Asaph, the name of three Israelites, and of the family of the first
properly, to mark (so as to be recognized), i.e. to remember; by implication, to mention;  to be male

who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
figuratively, to trust, be confident or sure
